intro: Tragia chlorocaulon, commonly known as the greenstem tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually green on both sides, giving it its common name. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Tragia chlorocaulon is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
